Has there been any talk about standardizing mentions to use a URL rather than using sigils?

For example:

-  #scuttlebutt -> ssb://scuttlebutt.hashtag
- @+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.ed25519 -> ssb://+oaWWDs8g73EZFUMfW37R/ULtFEjwKN/DczvdYihjbU=.feed.ed25519
- %FvFRSvn+npJiXRbqUy4GqCFo2JnOaWtPxuRSnAL+ZqQ=.sha256 -> ssb:///FvFRSvn+npJiXRbqUy4GqCFo2JnOaWtPxuRSnAL+ZqQ=.msg.sha256
- &5GEKOI/0YgTbK1WgGDQMHtWGJG6h2ferDw9D3PCDVbE=.sha256 -> ssb://5GEKOI/0YgTbK1WgGDQMHtWGJG6h2ferDw9D3PCDVbE=.blob.sha256

I'm sure there's plenty of bikeshedding to be done, but after spending some time working on our Markdown implementation I'm realizing that our shorthand links currently require a handful of jank to keep everything working correctly.
